methodology.description: This calculator combines verified U.S. Census Bureau data on marital status with Pew Research Center data on religious demographics to estimate unmarried Christian populations by age, gender, and religiosity.
dataIntegration: Census provides exact population counts by age, gender, and marital status
Pew provides Christian percentages by age with gender-specific rates
Religiosity filters apply Pew attendance/practice data
Denomination filters use Pew and IFS gender ratio data
calculations: Unmarried population = Never married + Divorced + (optionally) Widowed + Separated
Christian men = Unmarried men × Christian % for men in age bracket
Christian women = Unmarried women × Christian % for women in age bracket
Surplus = Christian women - Christian men (adjusted for religiosity and denomination filters)
limitations: Census data is survey-based with sampling error (CPS ASEC ~95,000 households)
Pew data is survey-based with ±2-3% margin of error
Gender-specific Christian rates by age are interpolated from overall gender gap data
Marriage market is not geographically uniform
Does not account for individual preferences, education, income, or location
strengths: Census data is from official U.S. government source with documented methodology
Pew RLS is the largest religious survey in America (36,908 respondents)
Gender gap data is directly sourced from Pew's published analysis
All sources are publicly verifiable with direct download links

verificationNotes: All primary sources verified accessible. Census CSV confirmed to match published tables. Pew percentages confirmed against executive summary.
